job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core activity of training AI models, which falls under the definition of model development and fine-tuning.

job_tasks.phrase: helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code
job_tasks.justification: This phrase specifies the type of generative AI models and the objective of the training process, aligning with the definition of fine-tuning for specific tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: engaging with these models as they learn to code
job_tasks.justification: This describes the interactive process of guiding the AI model's learning, which is an integral part of the training and fine-tuning lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
job_tasks.justification: This task involves the creation of specific data (questions and answers) that will be used for training AI models, fitting the definition of preparing data for training.

job_tasks.phrase: Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes a direct form of model evaluation and feedback, which is a crucial component of the model training and fine-tuning process.

soft_skills.phrase: Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
soft_skills.justification: The act of crafting and answering complex computer science questions requires analytical thinking, problem decomposition, and the application of knowledge to provide accurate solutions.

soft_skills.phrase: Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models
soft_skills.justification: Evaluating and ranking code necessitates analytical assessment, critical judgment, and the application of specific criteria to determine quality and performance.

profile.rationale: The job description focuses exclusively on tasks related to training and evaluating generative AI models (specifically LLMs that write code) through human feedback. These tasks fall under Macro-Category B (GenAI Specialization), specifically 1.B.1 (Model Development & Fine-Tuning) and 1.B.3 (Data Engineering & Management). There are no tasks described that belong to Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering). Therefore, the role is classified as a GenAI Specialist.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines the AI training and evaluation tasks, aligning them with GenAI specialization. While it mentions 'experienced software engineer' as a background, the core responsibilities are not traditional software development but rather AI model feedback. The clarity of the AI-specific tasks leads to a high confidence score.
